Text.Line: Do you see that man over there? He was once a brilliant student, always the top of his class.
But in his final year of exams, he became addicted to opening CSGO skin cases.
It started innocently, just a few euros here and there. But soon, he was using his entire savings account, money meant to pay for his studies.

DialogueOptions.AnswerText: It's his own fault, he should have never started. Luckily, not everyone ends up like this.
This is bad, but not everyone loses everything through gambling.
This is unfortunate, this man never got the help he needed.

Text.Line: Do you people have no sympathy for each other?
It's good to know some people still care about others.
Don't forget that the casino profits from his suffering, why don't you ban gambling?

DialogueOptions.AnswerText: In some countries, gambling is illegal. But banning it entirely won't solve the problem, people always find a way to gamble, even illegally.
Money from gambling often goes towards social programs. It's complicated: gambling can be harmful to individuals, but it also brings economic benefits.
People choose to gamble with their free will.

Text.Line: That doesn't help these gamblers at all.
How would you help this man?

DialogueOptions.AnswerText: I would kick him out of the casino.
I would advise him to seek help.
I would give him some extra money.

Text.Line: You don't see the real problem.
And how would you truly help him if I wasn't here?

DialogueOptions.AnswerText: What I said, I would do. Everyone deserves a chance to be helped.
I would pretend I never saw him and just walk away, it's easier to look the other way.
I'm not sure, but maybe I'd try to help him, as long as it doesn't cost me too much.

Text.Line: You mean what you say, I can respect that.
People really donâ€™t want to put effort into helping strangers.
